class_example: devatā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
english_translation: The deity addressed the Blessed One with a verse.

class_example: If you could practice undertaking these six cordial things, do you see any way of saying things (i.e. mode of expression), gross or subtle, which you could not tolerate?
atītaṃ n’ānvāgameyya, nappaṭikaṅkhe anāgataṃ.
english_translation: He should not return to the past, he should not anticipate the future.

class_example: te tāvataken’eva attamanā assu
english_translation: With just this much they would be pleased.

class_example: ce tumhe assatha kupitā vā anattamanā vā, tumhaṃ tena antarāyo.
english_translation: If you were to be angry or irritated, on that account [it would be] an obstacle for you all.

class_example: idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ
english_translation: In this regard, householder, some think [lit: there is thus for some], may I be of such form in the future, may I be having such feeling in the future.

class_example: idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ
english_translation: In this regard, householder, some think [lit: there is thus for some], may I be of such form in the future, may I be having such feeling in the future.

class_example: evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatamaddhānaṃ
english_translation: May I be of such form in the future.

class_example: tvaṃ moggallāna disā anuvilokeyyāsi nakkhattāni ullokeyyāsi
english_translation: Moggallāna, you should look all around in all directions, and look up at the constellations.

class_example: ce tumhe assatha kupitā vā anattamanā vā, tumhaṃ tena antarāyo.
english_translation: If you were to be angry or irritated, on that account [it would be] an obstacle for you all.

class_example: desetu, bhante, bhagavā dhammaṃ, desetu sugato dhammaṃ. santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti.
english_translation: Venerable Sir, let the Blessed One teach the doctrine, let the well-gone One teach the doctrine; there are living beings who have little dirt in their eyes, [who] are wasting away by the fact of not hearing the teaching.

class_example: desetu, bhante, bhagavā dhammaṃ, desetu sugato dhammaṃ. santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti.
english_translation: Venerable Sir, let the Blessed One teach the doctrine, let the well-gone One teach the doctrine; there are living beings who have little dirt in their eyes, [who] are wasting away by the fact of not hearing the teaching.

class_example: yāva’d’eva uppannānaṃ veyyābādhikānaṃ vedanānaṃ paṭighātāya abyāpajjhaparamatāya
english_translation: Only as much as for the freedom from obsessive pain at the most, for the warding off of oppressive feelings that have arisen.

class_example: abhijjhaṃ loke pajaheyyuṃ vigat’ābhijjhena cetasā vihareyyuṃ; abhijjhāya cittaṃ parisodheyyuṃ
english_translation: They would abandon covetousness with reference to the world, they would dwell with a mind free from covetousness, they would purify the mind from covetousness.

class_example: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ sammukhā sāruppāya gāthāya abhitthaveyyāmi
english_translation: Maybe I should praise the Blessed One face-to-face with an appropriate verse.

class_example: te tāvataken’eva attamanā assu
english_translation: With just this much they would be pleased.

class_example: ce tumhe assatha kupitā vā anattamanā vā, tumhaṃ tena antarāyo.
english_translation: If you were to be angry or irritated, on that account [it would be] an obstacle for you all.

class_example: desetu, bhante, bhagavā dhammaṃ, desetu sugato dhammaṃ. santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti.
english_translation: Venerable Sir, let the Blessed One teach the doctrine, let the well-gone One teach the doctrine; there are living beings who have little dirt in their eyes, [who] are wasting away by the fact of not hearing the teaching.

class_example: te tāvataken’eva attamanā assu
english_translation: With just this much they would be pleased.

class_example: aho vata mayaṃ na maraṇadhammā assāma
english_translation: If only we could be not of the nature to die!

class_example: te tāvataken’eva attamanā assu
english_translation: With just this much they would be pleased.

class_example: assosuṃ mallā, bhagavā kusinārāyaṃ parinibbuto’ti
english_translation: The Mallans heard, “The Blessed One had final Nibbāna in Kusinara”

class_example: evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ pabbajjā avaṅkatā avañjhā bhaveyya
english_translation: In this way, indeed, our renunciation would not be sterile, would not be dishonest.

class_example: evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ pabbajjā avaṅkatā avañjhā bhaveyya
english_translation: In this way, indeed, our renunciation would not be sterile, would not be dishonest.

class_example: aho vata mayaṃ na maraṇadhammā assāma
english_translation: If only we could be not of the nature to die!

class_example: bhikkhave, bhikkhū paccattaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti: “kin’ti anāgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyuṃ, āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsuṃ vihareyyuṃ?” iti
english_translation: Bhikkhus, the monks will establish mindfulness individually [with the intention]: “How then well-behaved fellow monks [who] have not come could come and (how) well-behaved monks [who] have come could dwell at ease?”

class_example: bhikkhave, bhikkhū paccattaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti: “kin’ti anāgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyuṃ, āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsuṃ vihareyyuṃ?” iti
english_translation: Bhikkhus, the monks will establish mindfulness individually [with the intention]: “How then well-behaved fellow monks [who] have not come could come and (how) well-behaved monks [who] have come could dwell at ease?”

class_example: mayaṃ migajātānaṃ āsayaṃ passeyyāma, yattha te gāhaṃ gaccheyyun'ti.
english_translation: “We could see the dwelling of a species of deer, where they would go [for] a hiding place.”

class_example: idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ
english_translation: In this regard, householder, some think [lit: there is thus for some], may I be of such form in the future, may I be having such feeling in the future.

class_example: kiṃ kareyya udapānena, āpā ce sabbadā siyuṃ,
english_translation: What one could do with the well, if always there could be water?; Having cut off the craving from the source, why would he go about searching?

class_example: In this regard, for a monk dwelling secluded, visitors would (come) - monks, male lay disciples, [and] female lay disciples.
english_translation: In this regard, for a monk dwelling secluded, visitors would (come) - monks, male lay disciples, [and] female lay disciples.

class_example: n’atthi taṃ kiñci lokasmiṃ yaṃ ahaṃ upādiyamāno na vajjavā assaṃ.
english_translation: There is not anything in the world which I am grasping [and] would not be with faults [i.e. and would not be blameworthy].

class_example: In this regard, for a monk dwelling secluded, visitors would (come) - monks, male lay disciples, [and] female lay disciples.
english_translation: In this regard, for a monk dwelling secluded, visitors would (come) - monks, male lay disciples, [and] female lay disciples.

class_example: tvaṃ moggallāna disā anuvilokeyyāsi nakkhattāni ullokeyyāsi
english_translation: Moggallāna, you should look all around in all directions, and look up at the constellations.

class_example: idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ
english_translation: In this regard, householder, some think [lit: there is thus for some], may I be of such form in the future, may I be having such feeling in the future.

class_example: idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ
english_translation: In this regard, householder, some think [lit: there is thus for some], may I be of such form in the future, may I be having such feeling in the future.

class_example: idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ
english_translation: In this regard, householder, some think [lit: there is thus for some], may I be of such form in the future, may I be having such feeling in the future.

class_example: yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāseyya
english_translation: If any monk should speak to a woman coarsely by means of obscene words…

class_example: yo pana bhikkhu oren’addhamāsaṃ nahāyeyya, pācittiyan’ti
english_translation: whichever monk should bathe within half a month, that is a pācittiya (a case requiring confession).

class_example: kiṃ kareyya udapānena, āpā ce sabbadā siyuṃ,
english_translation: What one could do with the well, if always there could be water?; Having cut off the craving from the source, why would he go about searching?

class_example: kin’ti me bhoge na corā hareyyuṃ
english_translation: How then could thieves not steal my valuables?

class_example: kiṃ kareyya udapānena, āpā ce sabbadā siyuṃ, taṇhāya mūlato chetvā, kissa pariyesanaṃ care?
english_translation: What one could do with the well, if always there could be water?; Having cut off the craving from the source, why would he go about searching?

class_example: bhikkhave, bhikkhū paccattaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti: “kin’ti anāgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyuṃ, āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsuṃ vihareyyuṃ?” iti
english_translation: Bhikkhus, the monks will establish mindfulness individually [with the intention]: “How then well-behaved fellow monks [who] have not come could come and (how) well-behaved monks [who] have come could dwell at ease?”

class_example: ce tumhe assatha kupitā vā anattamanā vā, tumhaṃ tena antarāyo.
english_translation: If you were to be angry or irritated, on that account [it would be] an obstacle for you all.

class_example: assosuṃ mallā, bhagavā kusinārāyaṃ parinibbuto’ti
english_translation: The Mallans heard, “The Blessed One had final Nibbāna in Kusinara”

class_example: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgāra-sālāyaṃ
english_translation: At one time the Blessed One was living in Vesali, in the great wood, in the hall of the building with the peaked roof.

class_example: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgāra-sālāyaṃ
english_translation: At one time the Blessed One was living in Vesali, in the great wood, in the hall of the building with the peaked roof.

class_example: siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo senaṃ gamanāya
english_translation: And if there might be some or other reason for that monk for going to see an army…

class_example: siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo senaṃ gamanāya
english_translation: And if there might be some or other reason for that monk for going to see an army…

class_example: rājāno coraṃ gahetvā haneyyuṃ vā bandheyyuṃ vā pabbājeyyuṃ vā
english_translation: The king’s men, having captured a thief, could kill (him) or imprison him or banish him.

class_example: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ sammukhā sāruppāya gāthāya abhitthaveyyāmi
english_translation: Maybe I should praise the Blessed One face-to-face with an appropriate verse.

class_example: mayaṃ migajātānaṃ āsayaṃ passeyyāma, yattha te gāhaṃ gaccheyyun'ti.
english_translation: “We could see the dwelling of a species of deer, where they would go [for] a hiding place.”

class_example: abhijjhaṃ loke pajaheyyuṃ vigat’ābhijjhena cetasā vihareyyuṃ; abhijjhāya cittaṃ parisodheyyuṃ
english_translation: They would abandon covetousness with reference to the world, they would dwell with a mind free from covetousness, they would purify the mind from covetousness.

class_example: bhikkhu seyyathāpi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ
english_translation: Imagine if a monk could see a dead body discarded in a charnel ground.

class_example: kiṃ kareyya udapānena, āpā ce sabbadā siyuṃ, taṇhāya mūlato chetvā, kissa pariyesanaṃ care?
english_translation: What one could do with the well, if always there could be water?; Having cut off the craving from the source, why would he go about searching?

class_example: ye kho tvaṃ dhamme jāneyyāsi
english_translation: Indeed, whatever things you might know…

class_example: jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā uppajjati manāpaṃ
english_translation: Having tasted a flavour with the tongue, a pleasant experience arises.

class_example: so tatonidānaṃ labheyya pāmojjaṃ, adhigaccheyya somanassaṃ
english_translation: Because of that he would obtain gladness, he would experience pleasure.

class_example: te tāvataken’eva attamanā assu
english_translation: With just this much they would be pleased.

class_example: siyā kho pana ananda, tumhākaṃ evaṃ assa — "n'atthi no satthā" iti.
english_translation: And now, Ananda, it could be thus would occur to you: “there is no teacher for us.”

class_example: te tāvataken’eva attamanā assu
english_translation: With just this much they would be pleased.

class_example: ime ce tumhe cha sāraṇīye dhamme samādāya vatteyyātha, passatha no tumhe taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n’ādhivāseyyātha?
english_translation: If you could practice undertaking these six cordial things, do you see any way of saying things (i.e. mode of expression), gross or subtle, which you could not tolerate?

english_translation: Moggallāna, you should look all around in all directions, and look up at the constellations.

english_translation: They would abandon covetousness with reference to the world, they would dwell with a mind free from covetousness, they would purify the mind from covetousness.

class_example: rājāno coraṃ gahetvā haneyyuṃ vā bandheyyuṃ vā pabbājeyyuṃ vā
english_translation: The king’s men, having captured a thief, could kill (him) or imprison him or banish him.

class_example: so tathāgataṃ pūjeti paramāya pūjāya
english_translation: He honors the Buddha with the highest veneration.

class_example: so tatonidānaṃ labheyya pāmojjaṃ, adhigaccheyya somanassaṃ
english_translation: Because of that he would obtain gladness, he would experience pleasure.
